result.title: Description of ALARM data platform.
result.description: This Deliverable will contain a cover page with the title of the deliverable deliverable number project information acronym grant number call topic consortium coordinator information edition date and number authoring and approval data sheet with the names of the authors reviewers internal to the project approval by PC Task Leader and WP Leader eventual rejection by any representative of the beneficiaries and document history the abstract of ALARM project An executive summary of the Deliverable highlighting the contributions main results and conclusions and some insight on how this deliverable will be feeding other tasks within the project An introduction to the topic including the motivation and goals of the deliverable the methodological approach to the conduction of Task 21 Data platform of ALARM EWS State of the art of EWS dedicated to ATM the results derived from these tasks Concluding remarks

result.title: Multi-scale modelling of polymer ageing
result.description: This deliverable will report the modifications needed on the different multiscale laws or models to take into account polymer ageing That could be changes in the formalism of the models identified in D43 or laws for the evolution of the parameters Models implemented will then be validated by comparisons of experimental tensile tests with results coming from the modelling of aged polymers

result.title: M-Sec Integrated Prototype – final release
result.description: EU leader WLI JP leader KEIOA deliverable of a prototypedemonstrator nature It is the outcome of the integration and porting activities of various functional components developed in WP4 as well as third party open source modules into a holistic seamless and fully functional MSec prototype for smart cities The deliverable is going to have two versions following the iterative approach described in section 311 Final release including the latest updates and improvements based on the feedback captured during the pilots

result.title: Methodology and tool for an economic evaluation of end-of-field life conversion
result.description: Decisionmaking framework and support tool that uses different input data such as specific heat extraction technology environmental data and proximity to end users and a grid The goal is to compare different options for heat andor electricity production and to choose the optimal one This deliverable highly depends on the deliverable D71 and will be developed based on the results of task T71

result.title: Hydro-thermal model using VSP analysis and colder reinjection tests
result.description: A comprehensive report presenting 1 the realized cold reinjections 2 their observed consequences on the reservoir and the power plant 3 the interpretations of those consequences in terms of modification of the conceptual reservoir and well model and 4 the final hydrothermal reservoir simulation taking into account the learnings from the cold reinjections and fracture system derived from the new VSP results D27 This achievement is very sensitive according to the project objective The probability of success will be evaluated by comparing the gap between measured and modelled temperature and hydraulic datasets
